articles.title: Quantitative methods for population dynamics
articles.contents:
What: Quantifying population dynamics is crucial for the conservation and management of animal and plant species. This workshop deals with the analysis and modelling of population dynamics. In this introductory workshop, we will cover population projection matrix models, the estimation of demographic parameters (e.g. survival, dispersal) using capture-recapture models and the estimation of population density and abundance using capture-recapture, N-mixture and distance sampling models. Our hope is to provide you with what you need to go your own path. The event is free of charge, and video-recorded.
For whom: This is a workshop for ecologists. Basic knowledge of R is required.
How: The format of the workshop will be a combination of lectures and live demonstrations in R with packages popbio, RMark and unmarked.
Who: Olivier Gimenez, Aurélien Besnard and Sarah Cubaynes.
When: March 21-22, 2022
Where: Online
Program
Population projection matrix models
Introduction to matrix models
Age- and stage-structured models
Leslie models as a particular case; sensitivity analysis.
Introduction to popbio
Further analysis issues: density-dependence; random environment; demographic stochasticity / branching processes; multisite and multistage models
Estimation of survival, transition between reproductive states, productivity using capture-recapture and generalized linear models
Survival estimation from capture-recapture data
Multiple group, age and cohort models
Incorporation of external covariates
Introduction to RMark
Further analysis issues: estimation of recruitment and population growth rate by reversing capture histories; multi-state models allowing estimation of transitions (including movements)
Estimating abundance and density of populations
Introduction to counting methods
Conventional methods and the detectability issue
Capture-recapture, N-mixture and line transect samplings
Introduction to unmarked
Further analysis issues: introducing covariates; heterogeneity
Requirements
Install R and RStudio.
Install the R packages unmarked and popbio.
Install the R package Rmark following the steps described at http://www.phidot.org/software/mark/rmark/.
